headline: Nvidia Stock Falls. ‘The Honeymoon Is Over for AI.’
summary: Nvidia  stock was dropping early on Tuesday, hit both by wider market jitters over President Donald Trump’s drive to acquire Greenland and doubts about where the artificial-intelligence boom goes from here.  Nvidia shares were down 2.9% at $180.84 in early trading Tuesday, while the  has fallen 1.1%, and the  has declined 1%.  The move was broadly line with the wider market: Technology stocks are out of favor as investors flee to haven assets such as gold.

headline: AI startup Humans& raises $480 million at $4.5 billion valuation in seed round
summary: AI startup Humans&, founded by former OpenAI, Alphabet and xAI researchers, has raised $480 million ​in a seed financing round, which values the company ‌at $4.48 billion, it said on Tuesday.  The outsized seed round highlights intense investor interest ‌in next-generation AI labs founded by veteran researchers as companies race to build systems that go beyond chatbots and agentic tools.  The round was led by Ron Conway's SV Angel and co-founder Georges Harik, ⁠while Nvidia, Jeff Bezos, ‌Alphabet's VC arm, GV, among other venture capital investors, also participated.

The outsized seed round highlights intense investor interest ‌in next-generation AI labs founded by veteran researchers as companies race to build systems that go beyond chatbots and agentic tools.  The round was led by Ron Conway's SV Angel and co-founder Georges Harik, ⁠while Nvidia, Jeff Bezos, ‌Alphabet's VC arm, GV, among other venture capital investors, also participated.

headline: World stocks sink, gold hits high on escalating trade war fears
summary: World stock markets lost ground on Tuesday, while precious metals hit fresh peaks on fears of a US-EU trade war fuelled by Donald Trump's tariff threat over opposition to his ambitions to grab Greenland, which has stoked volatility."Overall, this is a manmade crisis, and the continued sell off on Tuesday suggests that US threats to Greenland and their effects on financial markets could have further to go if the situation does not deescalate soon," Brooks opined.

headline: Amazon Drops Amid Declines Across ‘Mag 7’. What’s Hitting Big Tech Stocks.
summary: Amazon.com  was the one of the steepest decliners among the so-called Magnificent Seven stocks early on Tuesday.  The group of large technology companies were all falling as investors fled perceived riskier assets after President Donald Trump ramped up tariff threats against a number of European countries in his push for U.S. ownership of Greenland.  Amazon was down 2.5% in early trading while chip maker  Nvidia  was falling 3.2%.

headline: Tesla’s Musk Goes Big On AI Chips. Why the Stock Is Dropping.
summary: Tesla  stock was down in early trading on Tuesday, along with the market, after CEO Elon Musk pushed his artificial intelligence narrative over the long weekend.  Stocks tumbled on Tuesday as investors worried about President Donald Trump’s plan to impose tariffs on NATO members unless they allow the U.S. to acquire Greenland.  As for Tesla, Musk said the company’s AI5 chip design was “almost done” with the next generation in its “early stages.”

raw.headline: Tesla’s Musk Goes Big On AI Chips. Why the Stock Is Dropping.

Stocks tumbled on Tuesday as investors worried about President Donald Trump’s plan to impose tariffs on NATO members unless they allow the U.S. to acquire Greenland.  As for Tesla, Musk said the company’s AI5 chip design was “almost done” with the next generation in its “early stages.”

headline: Netflix Results to Shine Light on Fundamentals Amid Warner Fight
summary: Investors have been concerned about Netflix’s slowing flow of subscribers and the sustainability of its growth.  The issue sparked the worst selloff in the stock in more than three years after the company’s previous earnings report on Oct. 21.  At the time, Netflix was seen as a possible suitor for Warner Bros. Now that the deal is on the table at $82.7 billion, some investors are on edge and all the risks are amplified.

headline: Tech Weekly: Grok in hot water, app checks if you're dead or alive
summary: STORY: From Grok getting xAI in trouble to a Chinese app that checks if you're dead or alive, this is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyElon Musk's xAI imposed image editing restrictions on all users of its Grok AI chatbot.It happened after concerns grew when the service produced sexualized images.Governments and regulators from Europe and Asia had cracked down on sexually explicit content made by Grok.xAI said it implemented measures to stop Grok from allowing the editing of images of real people in revealing clothing.///U.S President Donald Trump imposed a 25% tariff on certain AI chips under a new national security order.Products affected include Nvidia's H200 and a rival semiconductor from AMD.The Trump administration argued the U.S. is too reliant on foreign supply chains which it called a national security risk.The move targets a number of high-end semiconductors meeting certain performance benchmarks and devices containing them.///TSMC profits jumped 35% in the fourth-quarter to $16 billion.The Taiwanese chip giant scored big from the AI boom and predicted more strong growth this year.It further said it was working on building fresh U.S. manufacturing capacity.TSMC - which counts Apple and Nvidia as major customers - announced plans last year to invest $100 billion in the U.S.////TikTok will roll out new age-detection technology across Europe in the coming weeks.The system analyses profile information, posted videos and behavioural signals to predict whether an account may be underage.TikTok said flagged accounts will be reviewed by specialist moderators rather than automatically banned.The rollout comes as European authorities look into how platforms verify users' ages under strict data-protection rules.////And a new app has gone viral in China which checks if users are still alive.The app called Sileme in Chinese translates as 'Are you dead?'It's aimed at people living alone or who live a solitary lifestyle.It sends automatic notifications to an emergency contact if the user hasn't checked in for consecutive days.Downloads have surged, leading the firm to introduce a subscription fee and change its name for a global audience.

raw.headline: Tech Weekly: Grok in hot water, app checks if you're dead or alive
raw.summary: STORY: From Grok getting xAI in trouble to a Chinese app that checks if you're dead or alive, this is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyElon Musk's xAI imposed image editing restrictions on all users of its Grok AI chatbot.It happened after concerns grew when the service produced sexualized images.Governments and regulators from Europe and Asia had cracked down on sexually explicit content made by Grok.xAI said it implemented measures to stop Grok from allowing the editing of images of real people in revealing clothing.///U.S President Donald Trump imposed a 25% tariff on certain AI chips under a new national security order.Products affected include Nvidia's H200 and a rival semiconductor from AMD.The Trump administration argued the U.S. is too reliant on foreign supply chains which it called a national security risk.The move targets a number of high-end semiconductors meeting certain performance benchmarks and devices containing them.///TSMC profits jumped 35% in the fourth-quarter to $16 billion.The Taiwanese chip giant scored big from the AI boom and predicted more strong growth this year.It further said it was working on building fresh U.S. manufacturing capacity.TSMC - which counts Apple and Nvidia as major customers - announced plans last year to invest $100 billion in the U.S.////TikTok will roll out new age-detection technology across Europe in the coming weeks.The system analyses profile information, posted videos and behavioural signals to predict whether an account may be underage.TikTok said flagged accounts will be reviewed by specialist moderators rather than automatically banned.The rollout comes as European authorities look into how platforms verify users' ages under strict data-protection rules.////And a new app has gone viral in China which checks if users are still alive.The app called Sileme in Chinese translates as 'Are you dead?'It's aimed at people living alone or who live a solitary lifestyle.It sends automatic notifications to an emergency contact if the user hasn't checked in for consecutive days.Downloads have surged, leading the firm to introduce a subscription fee and change its name for a global audience.

headline: Elon Musk Calls Ryanair CEO 'An Utter Idiot,' Floats Buying the Company
summary: Elon Musk is musing about acquiring Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) following a heated online disagreement with Ryanair CEO Michael O’Leary. The feud erupted last week after O’Leary dismissed the idea of incorporating Starlink internet devices on Ryanair’s fleet, attributing increased fuel costs to the weight and drag of the antennas. He projected that the service could potentially cost the airline a hefty sum of $250 million annually. Musk retorted by labeling O’Leary an “utter idiot” and s

headline: Tesla Stock Drops With Market. Musk Goes Big On AI Chips.
summary: Tesla  stock was down in early trading on Tuesday, along with the market, and after CEO Elon Musk pushed his artificial intelligence narrative over the long weekend.  Shares of the electric vehicle maker were off 2.6% at $437.52 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were down 1.5% and 1.6%, respectively.  Stocks tumbled on Tuesday as investors worried about President Donald Trump’s plan to impose tariffs on NATO members unless they allow the U.S. to acquire Greenland.

headline: Amazon Leads Declines Across the ‘Mag 7’. What’s Hitting Big Tech Stocks.
summary: The group of large technology companies were all falling as investors fled perceived riskier assets after President Trump ramped up tariff threats against a number of European countries in his push for U.S. ownership of Greenland.  Amazon was down 3.1% in premarket trading.  The high valuations of technology companies make them vulnerable to sharp drops as investors seek haven assets.

headline: Taiwan's Inventec says decision on Nvidia's H200 chip 'appears to be stuck' on China's side
summary: Taiwanese server maker Inventec said on Tuesday that a decision on whether Nvidia will ​be able to sell its H200 artificial intelligence chip in ‌China "appears to be stuck on the China side".  The U.S. formally approved the chip for export ‌to China last week with some conditions.  Reuters reported last week that Chinese customs authorities told customs agents that the H200 chip was not permitted to enter China though it was not clear whether this constituted ⁠a formal ban or ‌a temporary measure.

The U.S. formally approved the chip for export ‌to China last week with some conditions.  Reuters reported last week that Chinese customs authorities told customs agents that the H200 chip was not permitted to enter China though it was not clear whether this constituted ⁠a formal ban or ‌a temporary measure.

headline: Surrounded by billionaires in Davos, Trump plans to lay out how he'll make housing more affordable
summary: President Donald Trump plans to use a key address Wednesday to try to convince Americans he can make housing more affordable, but he's picked a strange backdrop for the speech: a Swiss mountain town where ski chalets for vacations cost a cool $4.4 million.  On the anniversary of his inauguration, Trump is flying to the World Economic Forum in Davos — an annual gathering of the global elite — where he may see many of the billionaires he has surrounded himself with during his first year back in the White House.  Trump had campaigned on lowering the cost of living, painting himself as a populist while serving fries at a McDonald's drive-thru.

Trump had campaigned on lowering the cost of living, painting himself as a populist while serving fries at a McDonald's drive-thru.
